review: We didn't end up getting pizza here but the food we got was very tasty and the atmosphere was nice. A lot of the other restaurants were very full but we had no issues getting in here. Still a little expensive but worth it in my opinion. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a more casual lunch or dinner when you're out shopping at Short Pump.

I decided to take a lunch break between shopping. This place was pretty busy for lunch but my waiter handled the lunch crowd pretty good. I had bread with olive oil dip to nibble on while I waited for my entree. My iced tea was always topped off. I had the grilled veggie salad and added chicken. The half size was a very generous portion of delicious goodness. Roasted eggplant, peppers, artichoke, asparagus, corn with lettuce and avocado. Yum!  I can't imagine what the full size salad looks like. I was stuffed after devouring the half size. The salted caramel pudding looked good but I had no room in my belly.

This was my first time visiting this pizza place! I've heard great things about them.  I ordered the mushroom sausage pepperoni lunch special  with a Caesar salad! The service was awesome and I would return. However, I had a small problem with a bug being in my salad. Initially he (not our waiter, possibly management) tried to disregard my concern for the bug in my salad saying it resembled the spice oregano. I picked around with my fork and explained to him that whatever it was had legs (possibly a gnat of some sort). I ordered the baked potato  soup as a replacement. All in all the food was great! I would revisit because my waiters service was awesome! The pizza was delicious and the salad was good minus the hiccup!

Hubby and I walked in, sat at bar for at least 5 minutes and not a single employee acknowledged us. We walked out and went to Cheesecake Factory where we had an excellent meal and service! I used to love CPK (first time visiting this location) but won't go back again.

This cali pizza kitchen is pretty good. Overall the food was good. We got BBQ chicken pizza with pineapple and the buffalo cauliflower. I wasn't expecting the cauliflower to be any good, my boyfriend ordered it. But it was amazing!! Super excepted. I'd try it. Also, the BBQ chicken pizza was your typical BBQ chicken pizza.  The service was good and everyone was friendly. They seemed a tad in experienced in the way the communicated with their customers but it didn't make a difference for us.  The food came out quick and everything was as it should be.

Went here over the weekend. They were pretty busy so we had a 10 minute wait. Our waitress was nice you could tell she was handling a lot of tables so she didn't linger at our table for very long, more of a pop in every once in a while which was actually fine for us that night. The big excitement for me however was the food! As I've started in other reviews I am a vegetarian so going out to eat for me sometimes can get pretty stationary. So imagine my excitement when I walk in and see buffalo cauliflower bites on the menu! They were sooooo delicious; I actually wish they put a little more on the plate because really how expensive can cauliflower be? We also ordered some mac n cheese bites, a veggie pizza and some drinks. We left very satisfied!

Went here for a relaxing lunch with a few friends. The meal started off fine: great service, great bread, great times. Then we got our entrees. My friend and I each got the bahn mi bowl, which looked interesting and different from the other items on the menu. As we were eating, my friend discovered that hidden in the miracle grain of quinoa, was a PIECE OF PLASTIC. Luckily she did not ingest said plastic, otherwise this would be an even ANGRIER review. The staff was responsive, however, and had the decency to attempt to make up for their carelessness by comping her meal.  The lesson learned is this: after a day at the mall, don't waste your time at this overpriced and neglectful chain, just go with your gut and get a pretzel hotdog from auntie Anne's.

Great pizza ,good drinks, poor service. Pizza arrived before the lukewarm appetizer, because our server "forgot about it". I would have enjoyed another drink, any drink, but was never asked. Come on management you train your kitchen so how about training your wait staff???

Went this afternoon. Thought to get 1/2 sandwich with salad for $14.45 but told did not have this for weekend so told will take whole sandwich and waiter did not know price but would get back 2 me. Well he didn't and I forgot to ask so ended paying $16.00 for turkey sandwich with nothing else-no chips no nothing. That is ridiculous-felt like I was in New York.

The sun was shining, weather spectacular and I got my tax refund...let's go to the mall!   Shopping and lunch...that's it, that was the agenda for our Sunday. I needed it after a long week. So, where to eat with my two teenage daughters--one loves seafood, curry, etc., the other one prefers carbs with a side of carbs...she hates seafood, so my preference of the Boathouse was off the table.  Bakers Crust is always insanely busy on Sundays; Firebirds I like, but not in the mood.  We haven't been to California Pizza Kitchen since we moved to RVA 10 years ago. Let's give it a try.  We got there around 12:30, and while they were certainly busy, we were seared right away. One thing I remember and continue to notice is that there's not much atmosphere here.  They do have really creative artwork made of pizza boxes, which I appreciate, but tables are stacked right next to each other.  So, unless you get a booth, you're not having a private meal.  For drinks, water all around and the Coppola Pinot Grigio for me.  I like some Coppola wines, but this one was...not good.  Not much going on and definitely no challenge for the palate. To be honest it was pretty watery. I can't help but to feel a loyalty to Coppola because eons ago when Francis Ford Coppola was just starting in the wine business, my husband and I were doing the Napa Valley Wine Train and Coppola was on the train.  I thought that was really cool, so if there are two equal wines on the list and one is his, I'll buy it. Blind faith in a winemaker is not smart...learned that the hard way.  Back to food.  My youngest daughter ordered the chicken piccata, which she let me sample. It was what you'd expect...lots of lemons, capers and slightly pan fried chicken cutlets with pasta, of course.  My older daughter ordered the half Chinese chicken salad and the kids Mac and cheese. She says the Mac and cheese is the same size as adult but for less. I tasted both and the salad was good, but the Mac and cheese boring. My youngest daughter pointed out that they probably make it bland for the kids' palates. Good call and smart move on their part.  I ordered a special cedar-plank halibut with butternut squash and quinoa, asparagus and a light cream sauce. The portion was huge!  Basically it was two meals in one. While everything was good (I loved the quinoa), the butternut squash was undercooked and still crunchy, and the halibut had not even a trace of cedar. I eat cedar plank salmon from Firebirds and from Artist Point in Disney World (OMG...THE BEST FOOD,), so I may have expected too much. I did enjoy the fish, which was simply seasoned with salt and pepper.  I think it's hard for a chain to provide a stellar meal, unless they have super high standards and put food first. While I don't think PKC is stellar, it is consistent and if you stick to what you know, you should be good. The total for our bill and tip was around $100.  I wish I had spent that $100 at Tazza Kitchen instead.

I didnt realize short pump town center removed the food court.. and since I was starving for lunch I ended up here. I was leery because based on the name I thought this was just a pizza place, and I wasnt in the mood for pizza. I was pleasantly surprised and happy to see a variety of choices on the menu. There was a wait to be seated, there was a crowded entrance full of hungry people waiting for tables. Our wait was about 15 minutes.  Once seated, our server Dominic came to take our orders, we chose the small plate spicy chicken tinga quesadilla as a quick appetizer. (What is tinga??) The small plates are really not an appetizer, its more of a side dish. It is on small size quesadilla cut into fours, and while it was delicious, its just a tease because its so small.  Entrees: I was disapointed to find out that although it was lunchtime, we couldnt order from the lunch menu because lunch prices are only served monday through friday. I cant understand why thats only a weekeday option??? Is it not lunch time on weekends and I missed that memo? The worst part was they only serve personal size pizzas on the lunch menu and my daughter couldnt get one because it was Saturday.  Needless to say, I  chose the California Cobb salad. This was just the right size for lunch. It had all the perfect blends of flavor a cobb brings smoked bacon, egg, chicken and gorganzola.  The rest of the table had avocado club egg rolls (yummy) , a steak with arugula salad and a kids menu cheese pizza. Everyone liked their food.  I will be back to try something else soon.

This restaurant was just mediocre. Maybe it's because I went with a lot of expectations, I was disappointed. The pasta was ok. Nothing phenomenal. We ordered the garlic fettuccine because it was a safe choice. Our table also got a chicken tequila pasta and it was NOT GOOD. The pasta literally tasted like peppers and the actual green peppers were soggy.  California pizza kitchen is known for its pizzas, and it was pretty good. Everyone seems to like the California club. It's a healthier choice because it's full of lettuce and avocados. The barbecue chicken pizza was good too, and the little bits of cilantro gave the pizza a kick.  Just another rant:  We ordered the barbecue chicken pizza with pineapples, but they forgot the pineapples. So when we told them that we wanted pineapples they gave us cold sliced pineapples in a little dish. The whole point of getting pineapples on a pizza is so they will be warm...  Finishing note:  I know that there are a lot of other restaurants in that area so I would go somewhere else with that money. I personally like Cheesecake Factory

This is a great place to go for lunch if you're just shopping around Short Pump! You get bread with your meal which is always good. Their artichoke pizza is great as well as any of the pastas. Service is pleasant. This is a great casual spot. Whenever I go I leave with leftovers.

The pizza was yummy but not worth the price tag or poor service.  It took an incredibly long time for our server to greet us and bring our drinks.  The poor guy had way too many tables to handle.  The white corn guacamole was delicious....but the portion you get is incredibly small, even for $5.  The guac is on the small plates menu rather than an appetizer so dont expect very much. I ordered the five cheese + fresh tomato pizza.  It was really good.  My sisters both ordered the tostada pizza and raved about it.  I expected a better portion for $13 - $15 pizzas.  That's like the price for a large or extra large in my hometown.  The flavor was there but the experience was lacking and didn't justify the cost in the end.

I've been here twice and I think it is the best option for food while shopping in the short pump. Their pizzas are really good, lots of ingredients and crispy crust, a little heavy but hearty. My favourite so far is the mushroom pepperoni. They have a 7' small pizza with a side of salad lunch offer that I highly recommend.

Well this place is ridiculous!!!!!!!!  Go nextdoor instead!   Got a salad yesterday and got 3 small strips of baked chicken so today (I'm out of town and its next door to my hotel), I decided to get the same Caesar salad but double chicken and no lie, it cost $24!!!!!  What a total rip off. CP, you need to re-evaluate.  You DEFINITELY lost my business for good.

It's overpriced for what it is.  Decent atmosphere.  Friendly staff.  It's a convenient place for a bite when we're out shopping with family.  We wouldn't make a special trip just to come here.  Everything on the wine list has a 4x multiplier.  Decent pasta dishes.  Decent selection for vegetarians.  Skip the souffle for desert... it's obviously not a real souffle (and we didn't expect one).  But, for a $10 kids desert we expected something tasty.  Dinner for 2 adults and 2 kids ran $115.  It's worth more like $75.

The food was okay at best. The service wasn't even that. We had to wait too many times to get refills on our drinks. I see why this place is only 3 stars. Maybe the best thing about this place will be the price.

Ordered dinner at 5:18 PM with eats.  At 6:45 PM the manager Adan Reyes asked me if I want him to place my order....  I told him I placed it at 5:18 and he said it was ready and sitting under the heat lamp....  he said he called the driver 15 minutes ago but still had not picked up.  Called back 7:10 and order has still not been picked up.  He really was rude and wanted to blame the EATS driver that he called for the first time when I called them.  It is 7:30 and I have not heard a word from anyone and doubt I will even receive the $77 dinner I got for the family!  Awesome customer service!  If you eat here after reading this you are a fool.

This was my second time eating at this particular location. I enjoyed every bit of food, just as I enjoyed it on my first visit. Today I ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza and Caesar salad (Lunch duo). Both were equally delicious! And I will definitely be returning here! I really want to try the mixed drinks, they looked good. Maybe next time.

Always good especially the BBQ chicken salad and BBQ chicken pizza. Kids like the Mac n cheese too.  Never a long wait and can dine inside or outside with typically good servers. Bar is never very full and games are always on the flat screens. The server this time left a little to be desired. Sort of attentive but we had to ask for refills and avocado for the salad was requested to be on the side but was mixed in as normal.  Overall typical experience.
Probably the best pizza I've had in a while. Very casual environment and the staff are pretty friendly for the most part! Would definitely visit again!!!

Stopped by CPK this past weekend for the first time in a long time. Definitely left with mixed feelings... As we walked up, there were two small (8.5" x 11") printed signs that basically said the A/C was out. We decided to brave it anyway and see how things went. We were "greeted" by two rude hostesses. When we asked if there was any outdoor seating, they sassed an older member of our party about the signage. It was cooler outside than inside, which is why we asked... (Throughout the night these hostesses continued to be unhelpful to customers as they were more interested in speaking to each other and were even discussing Yelp reviews at one point. I just found it to be inappropriate.) Our waitress was very sweet, but spacey. To be honest, I blame it on the heat! Food was good, no complaints there.  The most shocking part of the visit was that in our initial interaction with the waitress, I made a comment about the lack of A/C, and she responded "It's the 4th weekend in a row." Umm...EXCUSE ME??? I am not knocking CPK for this, because I am assuming that they rent the space from SPTC. It is ABSURD that it would take SPTC this long to fix a tenant's A/C in the summer heat. Really a bad look for mall management. I was surprised that after so many weekends there were no fans plugged in and sitting on the floor, but to me CPK is being treated unreasonably by SPTC. Shame on them. I am hoping that most of this weird experience is attributable to the workers being subjected to very hot working conditions for at least 4 weeks. I imagine that could be frustrating. Will try again once the A/C is back... who knows how many more weeks that could take!

Terrible service, excellent pizza. I came alone into the sparsely-filled restaurant during lunch service expecting friendly service and tasty pizza. I was sadly disappointed. My server, Gio, introduced himself nicely but as is soon find out, provided terrible service. After I placed my order of Pepperoni Pizza and a Sam Adams, I had to ask him twice for standard bread and olive oil. I normally never have to request this, and even at my previous times at this location (as recent as last week) this is usually not the case. After essentially nagging him for the bread, my main course came out. I was very disappointed that I couldn't enjoy the bread prior to the lunch course. When I asked him about why the bread came out with the meal, he grumbled "I was busy." He didn't have many other tables at the time and the only thing I could think he was busy doing was talking to the young lady working in the bar-kitchen area. The food was good but the service was not befitting that of California Pizza Kitchen's brand standard.

If you want terrible service GO HERE!! Food is great but the service is not. They don't get orders right and food and service takes forever. Walked in last week and saw at least 7 unbussed tables. Piles and piles of dishes and tables that hadn't been bussed the whole time I was there. Went with friends the other day and both of them ordered the small plate crispy mac and cheese and didn't know until they got the check that their order was wrong. They were brought the traditional mac and cheese which is DOUBLE the price of the small plate.

I work at the mall this week and next for training at one of the retail stores in the Short Pump Mall. I wanted something quick since my break is only 30 minutes. I ordered the BBQ sandwich there and was a little hesitant since it is known for its pizza. I was BLOWN away! The bread was sprinkled with melted cheese and crispy. The onions and slaw on top gave the best texture and crunch to the sandwich. It was estimated at 20 min before ready and was hot and ready in 15 minutes. I ate the entire thing and kind of wanted another one. I will definitely be ordering lunch from here next week as well!
Pizza is not that great. Crust is so chewy it almost. Rome my jaw. Go to Matchbox or BJ's for good pizza in Short Pump.

I said I'd never go back to CPK when they discontinued the Cheeseburger Pizza (sounds gross, but it was AWESOME).  However, I found myself having lunch there and loving it.   The White Pizza is still good.  This particular CPK is bright and spacious, connected to Short Pump Mall so definitely great for people-watching while you dine.  Especially if you get a window seat or take advantage of the outdoor seating.   Service was okay.  Nothing outstanding or horrific.  So ultimately, I guess I could stand to return, if need be.
Came in with a large party including 2 children and was surprisingly seated without a wait. Our waitress was super nice and the food was delicious. Loved our trip here and will definitely be back.

We usually really enjoy coming to CPK despite its priciness. This time around, quality was far from up to par and other restaurants nearby (like Cheesecake Factory and Maggiano's) would probably be a better bang for your buck.  We arrived earlyish for dinner and were seated promptly. Server came back frequently to check on us. Service was all fine and good - usually don't pay much attention to it - until we realized halfway out the door that every table except for ours had gotten bread before their meal! A travesty, really, that the bare minimum of restaurant service wasn't even achieved here. Second shock: menu was revamped (or should I say stripped down?) recently and we found that possibly the only distinctive, reliably tasty item on it was GONE. Moroccan chicken salad, anyone? Hands down our favorite salad and what we were looking forward to when we arrived.  Food came out quickly - like I said, service was all fine EXCEPT for the missing bread anomaly ??? - but was mediocre. The California cobb was fine, not worth the 15 or 16 dollars it cost, and every bite was like a sad, ghostly reminder of how much it WASN'T the Moroccan chicken salad (not kidding). Also ordered the Carne Asada pizza, which was also fine but standard fare at a pizza place or really any restaurant. So, it looks like we won't be coming back, unless MAYBE ... servers remember to bring the complimentary stuff (lol) and CPK resurrects our beloved salad. Please, it was too innocent and delicious to be a martyr for your "improved" menu. Don't change what already works.

Treated my sister to lunch here on 6/17/17, which was a busy Saturday.  We had a short (10 min).wait for for a table.  Server (Olivia) greeted us and took our drink orders - I ordered Water w/lemon and my sister had Sweet Tea.  She returned shortly with our drinks, but did not bring any bread (I know that it is usually brought out with the drinks) or lemon.  When our server returned to take our order, I asked about the bread and the lemon wedge she forgot and she replied "yeah you do get bread".  I heard other servers around us explaining the menu and offering suggestions, however our server did none of this.  I ordered the Thai pizza with 1/2 Cobb Salad and my sister ordered the Pepperoni pizza with 1/2 Cobb Salad - a lot of food! if  Olivia had informed us, we would have split a pizza. A few minutes passed and the bread and lemon wedge was brought to the table by someone other than the server. Our food arrived and we did not see Olivia for some time - my sister had to flag her down to ask for more tea!  When we were done, food boxed and ready to go, Olivia presented the bill and asked "How was everything?"  I replied that the food was good but her service was horrible. She simply stated "Oh, I'm sorry" and cleared the table.  I then asked to speak to a Manager who offered to comp our meals but I declined (however, did not leave a tip); I wanted to let her know how displeased I was with the level of service we received. Not sure if I'll dine here again.

Good food but horrible service. Have came here twice in the past 2 weeks and each experience hasn't been good at all.never got drink refills then server took our food from us and boxed up herself ( it was hand held food)... then took a while to take our checks up. Great food but just not good service!

Came here after Bakers Crust had a 20 minute wait... We are shopping with a 9 month old, and a stroller - as this is an outdoor shopping center.  When we arrive we inform the hostess that we require a high chair and would prefer be away from others, simply in case the baby begins to cry or raise hell. We also bring our stroller back with us, as it has much product in it, and our personal items - we were not going to leave it at the front of the restaurant, while sitting in the back. We were informed that they could only have high chairs along the back wall, so that no aisles were blocked for wait staff... Perfectly fine and understandable.  There are 7 tables along the back wall. One family was sitting in the middle of those 7, and we were placed at the very end corner. We placed the baby between tables so that he could have someone on each side of him. Not 10 minutes later, the hostess seats a family of four, also with a high chair at the table directly beside us. We then have to move the high chair we placed (for a reason) - as to not be rude to the newly arriving patrons. However, there were 6 other tables (with no one beside them occupied) along the wall in which high chair groups are placed...   I understand why everyone with a high chair is along the back wall, for exit reasons, open aisles for staff, etc... But with space elsewhere along this wall to sit people on top of each other is just irritating to say the least.  On top of that, the food was just 'okay.' The salad wraps were not good... And the lunch soup and salad option available on weekdays IS available during weekends at a different price for each... Which was fine as that's what we wanted - but the sandwich was again, just 'okay.'  The Baked Potato Soup was AMAZING... I would come here again for that... But for courtesy reasons - staff needs to be aware of seating and personal space, IF possible and not too busy of a time of day. For the sake of the review, the waiter we had, Giovanni, was very knowledgable, checked in often without hovering and was very kind. To be fair to management, we did not bring out concerns to their attention.

Pros: This is a great place to go for your brick oven pizza cravings!  The food is consistently good and that is what makes me keep coming back! Cons: The quantity of the food is always a bit disappointing. I had ordered a smashed pea and barley soup for an appetizer to share it with my husband and it arrived in a very shallow plate rather than in a traditional soup bowl and it was barely enough for one person.   The service is also a hit or miss and varies greatly depending on your server.

It had been a long time since I had entered a California Pizza Kitchen, so yesterday in light of a really crowded Cheesecake Factory and a famished family, we stopped there for lunch. After a 15-20 minute wait, we were seated. The waiter greeted us warmly and promptly. He rounded up our drinks in an equally efficient manner. My wife and son decided to split a pepperoni pizza and I went  for bbq chicken salad. While we waited for the entrees they brought us bread, with oil. It was warm and passable, but that's about it. The meal was delivered by the chef, unusual but a nice touch. the pizza looked freshly out of the oven and actually looked good. Unfortunately, that's pretty much where it ended with the pizza. My son took one bite and my wife one slice, before saying they didn't like it. I ate a piece and thought the sauce, cheese and pepperoni was decent, but for me the crust was just plain no good. It had a bitter taste that in the end threw off the balance for the entire pizza. The bbq chicken salad was pretty good with a nice variety of veggies and dressing. At a bit over 35 dollars without tip, it was way too much for the quality meal and amount of food.. With this combination, we won't be visiting here again soon...

Nice place.  Probably one of the more kid friendly restaurants within the mall itself.  I just can't help but say I'm never that big a fan of their pizza.  Maybe I just have to keep trying until I find that special one for me!

BEST Pizza EVER!!! We always get the wild mushroom on the honey wheat crust. It is wonderful every time. My kids like the 4 cheese and the Margarita pizza. We sometimes get one of their mini appetizers. They are super!!! The last couple of times we have tried their salads. The Mediterranean veggie salad was AMAZING!!! The service is super too! We live an hour away, but every visit to or through Richmond includes a stop at California Pizza Kitchen.
Visited during the afternoon boxing day. The pizza was mostly dough, inadequate topping. Not as expected.

There's a good kids menu.  Wish they had a buzzer system for when the place gets busy so everyone's not standing just inside the entrance.  The butter cake was bigger than I thought.  The bathroom sink in guys bathroom is a bit hard for smaller kids to reach.  I love the pizzas and salads - pasta dishes not so much.  Service has always been great.  I would give five stars if Apple pay is accepted and plastic gift cards could be replaced with egift cards.

This is always a family favorite with the kids. Everyone can get what they want and there are no arguments.they have a wide array of specialty pizzas and of course she can make one to fit your need. Service is always fast and friendly.

This California Pizza Kitchen is located in the Short Pump Mall, an affluent open air mall with stores like Nordstrom, Saks and other upscale shops. Outdoor dining is available but we opted for indoors on this cold November day. The interior is smaller than other restaurants I've experienced in the chain with dimmer lighting and darker fixtures, creating a more intimate space.  I was also pleasantly surprised by a minimal (2 minutes?) wait before being seated.  So far very good. Service was quick and our waiter very attentive, as if he anticipated our every want.  One person in our party remarked that our waiter could easily work in a very upscale restaurant with his level of service. My food was good not great.  The asparagus and arugula salad was a let-down but the meat lovers' thin crust pizza was tastier than expected, but who doesn't love more meat on a pizza?.  All in all things balanced out in the food department, yet the real plus for this CPK is the service

Not sure why I'm writing a review on cpk, but here I am. Much like any other chain, the menu is large and none of it is really good. not much else to say, other than I only eat here when work orders it
Pros: Pizza is delicious  Cons: Waiter was a bit harsh made things confusing while paying so we might come back

So I haven't been here in quite a while. First off, the wait was not bad, only 5 minutes for a party of 2 on a Saturday evening. Was greeted promptly however that was the only time our server was prompt. Took forever to get our orders and after that she did not bother to come by at all. As for the food, I have definitely much better at previous visits. The crust on my barbecue chicken pizza was soggy and the entire thing was less than flavorful. I should have just stayed at home and made some spaghetti and meatballs..... Lesson learned.

The service was excellent..quick and very nice.  The food was delicious...we hadn't been here for a very long time, at least 3 yrs and we were very happy. We had Marguerite pizza with jalapeño, cheese pizza with shaved parmesa, basically leaves and sun dried tomatoes, and a flatbread. Everything was very very good.

Food was good, but service not so much. Had a total of 7 dining in our party for my daughter's birthday. The server seemed agitated when she came to take our order that she had our table. She never checked by to see how things were once the food was served, so I never had silverware. Fortunately I was able to get one from the next table. She disappeared for a while, then whenever I saw her I tried getting her attention by putting my hand up slightly, she even made eye contact with me. Really seemed as though she was just avoiding me. She brought the cake out without a knife, and didn't come back. Finally was able to get her to come to the table so I could get the check. She came back fast to pick up payment. I'm not a picky diner, but this was too much.

I usually do not go to chain restaurants, particularly since Richmond has a lot of really great places to eat.   But if I find myself hungry when doing a bit of shopping at Short Pump, I tend to stop here.    I usually go for one of their chopped salads, as there are many options from which to choose. One of my favorite things about CPK is that I can order an "Arnold Palmer" (1/2 iced tea and 1/2 lemonade) and they know what it is. If it is just one or two of you, grab a seat at the bar for fast service without much of wait.

Wow. The manager on duty needs a lesson in customer  service   All I wanted was a salad minus the chicken with a little break on the price. This dude wanted to argue with me and make a point trying to proved how smart he was instead of just taking a couple of bucks off. Wow, they give food away all the time. I thought my request was reasonable   Why argue with a customer of a few bucks.  Ugh

I can't actually speak for the pizza, since I literally dropped in for a snack to up my blood sugar without ruining dinner, which was still two hours away or so, but my experience was pretty decent. I mentioned to the server when I got in that I was admittedly in a bit of a hurry- had an appointment in an hour- and he was very good at making sure my food got to me as soon as possible and then getting the check to me to deal with at my leisure so I wasn't stuck waiting. He did try pretty hard to get me to order a dessert or something else to pad my tab [or possibly because the cake is really awesome, it -looked- good] but I suspect that it's mandatory to do so and he wasn't super pushy, so whatever. I had the asparagus and arugula salad, which was absolutely delicious- very fresh and well-dressed without being drippy or wilted, and the focaccia side which was... it was tasty, but strangely sweet, which I hadn't expected? I left feeling much better, regardless, and in the space of about 30 minutes which was good since it left me a lot of time to get to my appointment. Other diners, it should be noted, were in no way being rushed, but allowed to enjoy their meal at their own chosen pace- the server just did a good job of working with what I had.

California Pizza Kitchen is one of my favorite pizza spots in Richmond.I love the different combinations of pizza CPK offer customers.I usually try different kinds of pizza each time I go but the BBQ chicken is my favorite.The avocado club egg rolls appetizers are delicious.For your sweet tooth,the tiramisu is really good.The pizzas are a bit pricey but it's quality pizza.CPK has a nice family atmosphere.The service is usually pretty good.CPK never has huge wait times like Cheesecake Factory & Firebird's in Short Pump.You usually do not have a problem getting in and out.CPK is always a good choice!

If I'm in Short pump this is where I'm at. A good spot whether you're looking for a quick bite or a a quality pizza.  Very kid friendly so if your looking for quit this is not the spot but the food is great the service is friendly and quick.
The food is great and comes out fast, but when someone less than 18 walks in with no adult then they serve you terribly.

The pizza didn't taste as good as the same pizza I purchased at Walmart. Also when your bill is $42 and I give 3 $20 bills ($60) to the waitress. Don't ask me if I need change back. 20 percent is $8 not $18. You sound like you are asking for a handout or stealing. I give 2 stars or the review won't get posted.
I received what I expected from this pizza restaurant - good pizza. Our server was great. The music needs to change in order to enhance the experience.

No wait for lunch on a Saturday at Short Pump mall. Seated immediately. Had the BBQ chicken pizza and California Club. Came out quickly with fresh ingredients. Server was attentive with drinks and complimentary bread as an appetizer.

It's ok for a lunch, service was a bit slow but everything we asked for was given with a smile.  The pizza was priced a little higher than I thought.  The flavor of the jerk chicken was plain. All in all I would not go out of my way to eat there.
Pizza is not so great. I expected more from a pizza restaurant. I've gotten better from Sbarro. The service was good but not a place I would suggest to visit again. Price too high for too little.

I enjoyed it...I haven't eaten any pizza here I didn't like.  The apps were great too. Positives:  the line ups weren't crazy, our server was great, the food was yummy, and I left satiated. I don't have anything negative to say about this visit actually.

First let me say that we LOVE CPK! But the one at Short Pump lacks everything of what to expect from CPK.  If you're food is correct, expect pleasant service in a kid-friendly atmosphere.  If you're food order is delivered wrong, delayed, or not delivered with the rest of your meal... Expect no management apologies without demanding to see one. But alas the manager is there...flirting or talking to his hostess staff at the front of the restaurant. At least that is what my wife and I experienced on our LAST vist. What a disappointment for an over $60 bill.  And if you're ordering take-out, double check your order before leaving, otherwise management will blame you for not checking. As if the missing bread and butter was so much cost to them!!! Or maybe they still can't figure out how to serve marinara sauce "hot" instead of chilled for spaghetti!

We love CPK! I am not typically a chain restaurant kind of guy but this place gets a pass.  The Moroccan Chicken salad is simply devine! It has an excellent range of flavor and incorporates fruit nicely.  The butter cake is friggin delicious. The name is a bit off-putting but it will be love at first bite, I promise!

Yes, it's a chain, but it's a good chain. Food is always consistently good and service is also. We went last night for the first time in a while and they seem to have added a lot of new items to the menu. The White Carribbean Sangria was delicious. I ALWAYS enjoy the Cobb Salad (ask for them to add the beets!) I didn't care much for the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza though - the sweet sauce didn't go well with "pizza" for my tastes. But now I've tried it and I know. It's a great place for family dining and there are booths you can put a stroller next to for smaller babies who can't sit in a high chair yet. Next time I go I want to try the new Strawberry Mojito.

Eh.....That about describes it.  A chain restaurant, with decent, but not amazing pizza.  The chop salad is excellent.  The decor is somewhat lacking.  My problem with eatting here is that I'm not sure if i'm in Richmond, Atlanta, or Baltimore. It is kid friendly and a safe pick.

Generally speaking I avoid chain restaurants but due to circumstances I was recently at the CPK in short pump.  As chains go this is one of the better ones and would give it three and a half just because it doesn't reach the quality of establishments I consider four stars.  I split the  habanero carintas pizza and tostada pizza with my girlfriend.  The carnitas is pulled pork and red onion with a side of salsa to go on top.  This was pretty decent especially the salsa which is very hot.  The tostada is black beans tortilla chips lettuce and ranch with traditional salsa to go on top.  We elected to add lime chicken as well.  Server was very helpful and friendly almost a bit too much.  If he was in a certain film he would be wearing many pieces of flair but I suppose this is better than bad service.   Going here with the proper mindset is important.  Its different than regular pizza and is what it is..an above average national chain.  There will be no culinary masterstrokes but if one can abandon the culinary elitism that is endemic will be a pleasant evening.  Also for 80 bucks you can get 100 in gift cards from Costco so there's that.
My family loves this restaurant. We go there almost every other week. The chipotle pizza is the best of all pizzas ever made in usa and Sedona tortilla soup is super yummy.

Went in for a half of Chinese Chicken Salad and now I wish I didn't.  The chicken definitely tastes like it was pulled out of a sandwich bag and slightly warmed prior to putting on the salad (actually think the chicken from McDonalds is better quality).  My salad had aging spots on it (from being in a bag too long); however their dressing (which is very good) does a decent job masking it all.  It was crunch time and I needed a quick meal which I now regret. If you have to come here stick to the pizzas.
We love love love the Tostada pizza and Tortilla soup. The service at this location is really good! Mac n Cheese from kids menu was a little dry. Other than that awesome!

Weird thing happened last night: we went in around 9:15 and requested to be seated outside ( plenty of empty tables). The brown haired host immediately blurted out " we're not seating outside anymore".  You could tell that was a lie from the way she said it and also from the fact that they continued to seat people out there for the next hour. When I asked when they usually close the patio for my future knowledge, she said "no set time, it just depends on our manager" . So, I suppose that means crappy/discriminating manager and similar, dishonest host? We probably should have walked next door to bakers crust right then. But poor decision made, we proceeded to stay for: hard, stale bread ( not provided until we asked), used dipping oil ( also not provided until we asked), salads with ingredients missing that gave us upset bellies and unusually soggy pizza. The waiter was cool though. We usually love the CPK chain and have dined here as well as others several times. This was a one off experience but worth sharing in case you encounter similar discrimination there.

The pizza is delicious, but it's not cheap.  Of course it's worth it because it's always so good.  I enjoy the thin crust pizzas which have a good flavor, but are not heavy with crust. Very popular and often has a line.
Zack was our server and he was very nice. The food came fast and everything tasted good. No complaints. Fish tacos were good , caesar salad was excellent .

Absolutely delicious! I have eaten here dine-in several times, and the food is always great, and the service is fast and friendly!  After doing some shopping at short pump tonight, we stopped in and ordered some food to try their take out! We ordered, paid, and got our meal to-go in under 10 minutes (and it was very busy at the bar/takeout area). Overall very impressed with CPK!

Loud, loud music, and a dirty bathroom. When did CPK start playing such loud music? It felt like trying to eat at a Friday's. Although half the restaurant was empty, they tried to seat us at one of those tables where it feels like you're eating with the people seated next to you. My first unpleasant experience at a CPK.
The food was good, and our waitress even better! I've never had service where I thought I was really being cared for. Definitely am coming back the next time I'm in the Richmond area!

love California Pizza kitchen...This was our first time eating in the Short Pump location. Food was good as usual and the waitress was very friendly...(we grew up within 15 min of each other) small world

My favorite part about CPK is their strawberry lemonade. I can't find a better strawberry lemonade than here. Pizza is really good. It comes on that thin crust and is crispy.  They have a nice little outdoor patio as well.
I recommend the Garlic Chicken pizza, and the Habenero Carnitas pizza.  Both are excellent choices.  We've always had pleasant/timely service!

I'm normally a fan of cpk but this one was just okay. I got my normally California club pizza with honey crust. My lettuce was drenched in mayonnaise. The pizza was dry. The crust was a little too soft. Definitely not as good as the pizza I normally get at cpks
Consistent, love the thin crust pizzas and the roasted vegetable salad. The tortilla rolls are amazing and truly gluttonous, and it's a great place to take the family.

I don't think it's as good as it once was.  I miss the sliced sausage they used to use, as I'm not a big fan of crumbled sausage on my pizza.  As others said, it's VERY expensive.   My wife and daughter split one pizza with 1/2 pepperoni and I had one pizza with pepperoni/sausage.  Add 3 sodas and tip, and that quick lunch turned into $42.00.  Quite a bit of money for 2 tiny pies with hardy any toppings.
I was staying in the area once again.  Made a trip back to this restaurant. Was very happy with the food and service once again (see previous review).

Was here all by myself, which was good since I got to go ahead of all the families with shrieking kids and sit at the bar. The hostess apologized for me sitting at the bar, but I said it was ok, and that I wanted to sit there.  The bartender/waiter was extremely fast and nice. It was amusing to see him and another waiter complain about this table full of fussy ladies who wanted like five of those small bottles of sparkling wine.  Oh right, my food. My Guiness (served in a cold glass) was good, and my appetizer (the thai spring rolls) were also good, rounding my order out to $13.

Well, it isn't Chicago pizza (the best in the world) but for the California Pizza Kitchen is typical for the franchise. Not really pizza (a great pizza of crust, sauce and cheese as a base should be superlative, as a great Chicago style will have), but the extreme variations at CPK is a different taste that is ok if looking for a non-traditional product. Richmond really needs a 5 star pizza, but unfortunately all fall short.

As usual, the food and service were good.  My friend had never been before, and she enjoyed it.  We had the BLT pizza, and it tasted just like an open-faced BLT sandwich.  The place was packed--as usual--but we got a seat within a couple of minutes.
Exactly what you expect in terms of food. Extremely friendly service.
